content:
Diagnosis:		Papillary thyroid carcinoma

Management:		Total thyroidectomy March 2023
		Radioactive iodine ablation May 2023

Histology:		pT1N0M0 papillary thyroid carcinoma
		BRAF V600E mutation positive

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well with no concerning symptoms. Her TSH is appropriately suppressed at 0.1 on Levothyroxine 150mcg daily. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable at <0.1. Neck examination shows well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities. Recent ultrasound neck (15/4/24) confirms no suspicious features. She will continue current dose of Levothyroxine and we will see her in 6 months with repeat thyroglobulin and TSH. Ultrasound surveillance will continue annually.

cancer_timeline.value: Ultrasound neck confirms no suspicious features

patient_facts.value: Well-healed thyroidectomy scar with no palpable abnormalities
TSH appropriately suppressed at 0.1 on Levothyroxine 150mcg daily

status_updates.value: Early stage papillary thyroid cancer treated with surgery and radioactive iodine. Currently well with no evidence of disease on surveillance
Repeat thyroglobulin and TSH in 6 months, annual ultrasound surveillance
